divs: Sighting DetailsI was up at about 11:30 PM to get a glass of water. I live in Sherwood Park, Alberta. I put some ice in the water and went to my south facing windows to have a look outside. I started to check out the stars. It was a clear night. Just then I saw a brilliant gigantic photoflash in the sky over the Camrose area. It was so bright I was startled. I continued watching to see if it would flash again, but nothing happened. I was about to go back to bed, when suddenly I saw an orange orb flying through the sky. It was coming from the direction of Ferintosh. I grabbed my camcorder and started taking video. It was bright. Brighter than the stars. I continued watching as I realized it was not a satellite, flying a slightly arced path from SE to NW. It passed to the east of Sherwood Park, probably over Toefield and I lost sight of it behing my house roof line. I ran to my front door(facing north) and picked it up again, headed to Ft. Saskatchewan or St. Albert, where it suddenly stopped. I got tired of watching it and went to bed. I got up a few times more and checked on it. It stayed there all night. I played the video only to find that my camera recorded nothing. Not even the stars.
